Number Four The Dark Knight Rises
the smell marks the final installment in
Christopher Nolan's Dark Knight trilogy
after Batman Begins and The Dark Knight
now it takes place eight years after the
events of the latter and introduces a
villain Bane played by Tom Hardy the
certified fresh flick has an audience
score at 90 percent with one audience
review saying that quote Nolan's epic
Trilogy concludes in glorious fashion
and gives us a thought-provoking and
suitably satisfying conclusion to an
epic Saga well said
number three Zack Snyder's Justice
League
this is the director's cut of the 2017
film Justice League as director Zack
Snyder intended it now he actually
stepped down during post-production
following the death of his daughter and
Joss Whedon was hired to finish that
film and what began as a social media
pipe dream ended up becoming a movement
to release this version with an online
petition that gained more than a hundred
and eighty thousand signatures along
with public support from Justice League
stars like Ben Affleck galvado and Jason
Momoa coming as a four-hour film instead
of the ones considered mini-series
format this updated version came with a
70 million dollar price tag for visual
effects score editing and new filming
but the improvements in both Tomato
Meter and audience scores over the first
one is something you just can't put a
price on am I right
